sentences.english: She is a die-hard fan of Johnny Deep.
sentences.chinese: 她是強尼戴普的死忠影迷。

sentences.english: Why do you think fans will really enjoy the "Legacy of Terror" episode?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你認爲影迷們會非常喜歡《魑魅魍魎》這一集？

sentences.english: Now the angry fans and media have subsided.
sentences.chinese: 現在影迷和媒體的憤怒都已經平息。

sentences.english: The fans surged forward to the the movie star.
sentences.chinese: 影迷們洶湧地奔去看那個影星。

sentences.english: I can’t do anything there. There are all these screaming fans.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏，全部都是尖叫的影迷，我什麼都做不了。

sentences.english: Fans thronged to the entrance of the theatre to see the famous actress.
sentences.chinese: 影迷們擁向劇院的入口爭睹著名女影星。

sentences.english: Fans mobbed the actor wherever he went.
sentences.chinese: 那位演員走到哪裏，影迷們都圍着他。

sentences.english: Canadian Transformers Live Action Movie Fans are in for a treat.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大變形金剛真人電影迷都在爲一種享受。

sentences.english: So Japan had invited Ggong to have his fans meeting there.
sentences.chinese: 所以日方邀請孔劉來日本舉行影迷見面會。

sentences.english: The crowd in Hall H certainly didn't object.
sentences.chinese: 當然，在H大廳的影迷並不會有異議。

sentences.english: The death of Satoshi Kon shocked every fans over the globe.
sentences.chinese: 今敏之死讓全世界的影迷感到震恐。

sentences.english: A crowd of fans surrounded the actress.
sentences.chinese: 一羣影迷圍繞在女演員的身邊。

sentences.english: As a hard-core film geek, I've seen plenty of sci-fi posers.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個鐵桿電影迷，我看到過很多科幻影片。

definition: to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
(of a movie, show etc) to attract large audiences
